displayed_text: The surge in unemployment-insurance claims started six weeks ago when shutdowns to contain the virus became widespread. Americans also cut back on spending by 7.5% in March, the biggest monthly decline on record back to 1959, and saw personal income fall by 2%, the largest decrease since 2013. Stock markets slipped on the data’s accounting of economic damage from the virus.
